Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay to see Rome”
Reviews.Author: OntarioTravellers2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to the train station which made it easy to get into Rome. The owner was so helpful and the room was clean and spacious with a balcony. The breakfast, which was included, was quite nice. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor evening connection to downtown”
Reviews.Author: puishor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, quiet and clean, the stuff friendly but their english is not the best. It's very close to the Octavia train station. The connections to the center of the city are ok in the morning, as the trains come every 15-20 minutes, but in the evening they only go every 40-50 minutes, and the last train starts a bit too early from downtown(around 10:30 PM) There are some night busses but the bus stop is not so close to the hotel. There are some trains that do not stop in Octavia, so make sure you ask someone before getting on, as the station displays might be missleading. The breakfast is typical italian one, with croissants and a lot of sweet things, no salty things like vegetables, cheese, eggs or ham.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Octavia
HotelInfo.Address: Via Bottari Giovanni Gaetano 38, 00135 Rome, Italy
